BodyMap.description: An interactive SVG component representing the human body.
features: Clickable zones (Head, Chest, Arms, Legs, Feet)
Visual feedback on hover (fill color change)
Ability to place 'markers' (dots) on specific coordinates for wounds
BodyMap.implementation_note: Use a standard SVG silhouette. Wrap paths in clickable groups. Use React state to track selected zones.

AgendaCalendar.description: A specialized calendar view for nursing appointments.
features: Color coding: Blue for MED, Green for PICC
Drag and drop support (optional but preferred)

glassmorphism.header: bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-md border-b border-slate-200/50 sticky top-0 z-50

login_background.description: Clean, white medical hallway for login background. Use with overlay.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. UPDATE THEME: First, modify /app/frontend/src/index.css with the CSS variables provided in the 'colors' section. This is critical to establish the 'Sterile Blue' identity.
2. INSTALL DEPENDENCIES: Ensure 'lucide-react' is installed for icons. Use 'date-fns' for calendar logic.
3. COMPONENT LIBRARY: Use the existing Shadcn components in /app/frontend/src/components/ui. Customize them via Tailwind classes if needed, but prefer composition.
4. BODY MAP: Create a new component 'BodyMap.js' (or .jsx) that renders an SVG. Do not use an external heavy library. A simple SVG with 'path' elements having 'onClick' handlers is sufficient.
5. DATA-TESTID: Add 'data-testid' to all inputs, buttons, and clickable rows. Format: 'page-section-element' (e.g., 'login-form-submit').
6. RESPONSIVENESS: The Agenda must be usable on tablet. On mobile, switch to a 'List View' instead of a full calendar grid.
7. PDF/WORD: For the 'Modulistica' section, mock the download functionality. You can create dummy buttons that trigger a toast notification saying 'Downloading PDF...'.
8. NAVIGATION: Implement a Sidebar for desktop and a Bottom Nav or Hamburger menu for mobile.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
